title: Project Engineer Job at the Advertisers
content:
The Advertisers is a dynamic business-driven HR arm specializing in providing tailored staffing solutions for startups and other companies in need of trusted employees. With a focus on understanding the unique needs and culture of each client, The Advertisers leverages its expertise to recruit top-tier talent that aligns seamlessly with the company's goal and values.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Engineer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Project Planning: Developing project plans, schedules, and budgets for the installation and implementation of CCTV, Access control and Alarms systems.
	System Design: Designing CCTV, Access control and Alarms systems based on client requirements, site surveys, and technical specifications.
	Integration & Testing: Integrating CCTV systems with other security solutions or building management systems and conducting testing to ensure proper functionality.
	Troubleshooting & Maintenance: Providing technical support for troubleshooting issues with installed CCTV, Access control and Alarms systems and conducting regular maintenance to ensure optimal performance.
	Documentation & Reporting: Maintaining detailed project documentation, including as-built drawings, equipment lists, test reports, and providing regular progress reports to stakeholders.
	Compliance & Standards: Ensuring that all installed CCTV systems comply with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices.
	Installation, servicing / maintenance, testing, commissioning of Intruder Alarm Systems – IP Surveillance Systems and Access Control Systems or related equipment, follow schematic drawings and building plans in accordance with relevant Codes of Practice/Policies.
	Providing a quality installation in the most methodical and efficient manner, including the ability to digest detailed scope of works and working drawings.
	Liaising with ARC (Alarm receiving centres)
	Production of high quality commissioning and handover documentation and as fit drawings.
	Maintaining safe work environment at all times and have a good understanding of Health and Safety i.e. Method, Risk assessments, safe working procedures etc.
	Client training and demonstration of systems to explain the systems working and functionality.
	Demonstrate a general knowledge of Security Systems - Intruder Alarms, Access control, CCTV and Intercom
	Demonstrate strong communication skills.
	Sound administration skills with an understanding of the importance of paperwork and the accuracy and timeliness of submission of same.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications in a related field with experience.


Technical Competencies:


	Desirable Knowledge of IP Systems / Networking is preferable.
	Knowledge of various manufacturers equipment i.e: Paxton, Honeywell, Texecom, Bosch, Hikvision etc.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application Letter and CV to: currentadvertiser@gmail.com using the Job Position "Example: Project Engineer - Lagos State" as the subject of the email.

Note


	Please be aware that only candidates residing in Lagos State will be considered for this position, as proximity to the workplace is an essential requirement.
	Additionally, any candidate who provides a false address during the application process and is subsequently hired will be subject to termination if their actual location impacts their performance or ability to meet all deliverables.

title: Warehouse Officer Job at Bogo Beverages Limited
content:
Bogo Beverage Limited is a young and dynamic total manufacturing, distribution and marketing of quality beverage company, with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and growth mindset. We are determined to dominate the beverage sector with our quality brands, apt commercial acumen and cognate experience of the Nigerian consumers and Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Officer
Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Logistics / Supply Chain
Reports To: Supply Director

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Warehouse Officer is responsible for overseeing the daily operations of the warehouse, ensuring accurate inventory control, safe storage of goods, and efficient dispatch and receiving processes.
	The role supports the smooth functioning of the supply chain by maintaining accurate records, coordinating logistics, and ensuring compliance with safety standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Receive, inspect, and verify incoming goods against delivery documents.
	Organize and store items in appropriate locations for easy access and retrieval.
	Manage and update inventory records using warehouse management systems (WMS).
	Maintain cleanliness and orderliness in the warehouse at all times.
	Operate warehouse equipment such as forklifts and pallet jacks (if certified).
	Prepare and dispatch outgoing shipments as per schedule and order requirements.
	Conduct regular stock counts and reconcile physical inventory with system records.
	Monitor warehouse layout and ensure optimal use of space.
	Coordinate with procurement, logistics, and other departments for timely deliveries.
	Ensure all warehouse activities comply with health, safety, and quality standards.
	Report any discrepancies, damages, or losses to management promptly.


Requirements


	Education: High school diploma or equivalent; certification in logistics or supply chain is a plus.
	Experience: 2+ years in a warehouse or logistics environment.


Skills:


	Good knowledge of inventory and warehouse management systems.
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Basic computer literacy (Excel, ERP/WMS software).
	Physical stamina and ability to lift heavy items when necessary.
	Forklift operation certification (if applicable).
	The candidate must be living in Lagos.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers.bogo@outlook.com using "Sales Executive – Kano" as the subject of the email.
